DOC.brief_summary: This study continuation follow-up two previous study ( RRISK RRISK2 ) conduct Kaiser Division Research . This study invite previous study participant , well randomly select group Northern California Kaiser Permanente Members , participate interview , mail survey lab visit . DOC.detailed_description: Using cohort establish two previous study ( RRISK , CN-97Svand-01-H RRISK2 CN-02Svand-07-H ) , study follow well characterize cohort middle-aged old woman member Kaiser Permanente Medical Care Plan ( KPMCP ) Northern California continuously since age 18 . The cohort compose 2000 woman data abstract medical record , in-person interview , void diary , physical assessment , laboratory data , bank serum . Our cohort unique include substantial number woman 4 major ethnic/race group ( white non-Hispanic , Black , Asian Hispanic . ) For study , re-interview many study participant RRISK RRISK2 willing . This study also expand increase diversity add total 450 Black , Asian Hispanic woman cohort . The overall goal study advance understand mechanism Urinary Incontinence facilitate translational development novel approach treatment prevention .
DOC.criteria: previously participate RRISK RRISK2 study kaiser Division Research . Not part previous RRISK RRISK2 cohort .
